titleStmt.title: The true effigies of our most illustrious soveraigne lord, King Charles Queene Mary, with the rest of the royall progenie. Also a compendium or abstract of their most famous geneologies and pedegrees, expressed in prose and verse. With the times and places, of their births.
titleStmt.author: Hollar, Wenceslaus, 1607-1677. engraver
Merian, Matthaeus, 1621-1687. engraver

publicationStmt.publisher: for John Sweeting, at the signe of the Angell in Popes-Head Alley,

notesStmt.note: Text (in verse) on numbered versos; portraits on facing rectos.
Some ports signed "W. Hollar" or with initial "H"; plate on p. [11] has signature "M.Merian J.[i.e. Junior]".
Imperfect; lacks the portrait of Elizabeth and the text on Anna deceased (pages 14-15).
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the signe of the Angell in Popes-Head Alley
